Description: Used by the User to damage Target.

Parameters.Description: What will deal damage. Generally Source, but can be anything.
Who will receive the damage. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
Base damage of the action, before Defense applies. Can be a flat number, Dice Notation, or a mathematical expression. Decimal numbers will be rounded down to the nearest integer.
Reduces a certain amount of Attack to get the final damage value. Can be a flat number, Dice Notation, or a mathematical expression. Decimal numbers will be rounded down to the nearest integer.

Indicates the odds for the Attack to land. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.
Indicates the odds for the Attack to score a Critical Hit, if it lands.
The damage formula to use if the Attack scores a Critical Hit.
Indicates the Element used by the Action to deal damage.
If true, the Target's Element's Resistance stat (if it has one) will be ignored.
If true, the Action Element's OnAfterAttack Action will not be executed.

Description: Used by the User to remove some of Target's MP.

Parameters.Description: What will burn MP. Generally Source, but can be anything.
Who will get MP burned. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
Amount of MP that will be burned. Can be a flat number, Dice Notation, or a mathematical expression. Decimal numbers will be rounded down to the nearest integer.

Indicates the odds for the Attack to land. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

Description: Used by the User to remove some of Target's Hunger.

Parameters.Description: What will remove Hunger. Generally Source, but can be anything.
Who will get Hunger removed. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
Amount of Hunger that will be removed. Can be a flat number, Dice Notation, or a mathematical expression. Decimal numbers will be rounded down to the nearest integer.

Indicates the odds for the Attack to land. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

TreeViewDisplayText: Steal an Item that is ({ItemType}) from Target
Description: Used by the User take an item from Target's inventory and put it into their own.

Parameters.Description: Who will have an item stolen. Generally Target, but can be any Character.

Indicates the odds for an Item to be stolen. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If false, the User will pretend Target has no Weapons or Armor in their inventory.
If false, the User will pretend Target has no Consumables in their inventory.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

Description: The way the calling object shows up in the Console Client will be modified.

Parameters.Description: The Character that will replace the current Console Representation's one.
The Background Color that will replace the current Console Representation's one.
The Foreground Color that will replace the current Console Representation's one.

Description: The display appearance of User in the Console Client will be turned back into the original.
The User will try to remove Target.

Parameters.Description: What will be removed. Generally Target, but can be anything.

Indicates the odds for Target to be removed. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

Description: If Player can see the User (if visibility checks must apply), text will be printed into the Message Log.

Parameters.Description: What will be printed. Can be a Locale.
The Color in which the Text will be printed. If left empty, it will be white.
If true, the message will be printed even if the Player can't see the User.

TreeViewDisplayText: Show a Message Box with Title ({Title}) and Text ({Text})
Description: Player will see a Message Box on their next turn.

Parameters.Description: The Message Box's Title. Can be a Locale.
The text in the middle of the Message Box. Can be a Locale.
The Color of the Message Box border.

Description: Used by the User to heal Target.

Parameters.Description: What will heal. Generally the User, but can be anything.
Who will be healed. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
Maximum Amount of Damage that will be healed. Can be a flat number, Dice Notation, or a mathematical expression. Decimal numbers will be rounded down to the nearest integer.

Description: Used by the User to give Target some MP.

Parameters.Description: What will give MP. Generally the User, but can be anything.
Who will get MP. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
Maximum Amount of MP that will be recovered. Can be a flat number, Dice Notation, or a mathematical expression. Decimal numbers will be rounded down to the nearest integer.

Description: Used by the User to give Target some Hunger.

Parameters.Description: What will give Hunger. Generally the User, but can be anything.
Who will get Hunger. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
Maximum Amount of Hunger that will be recovered. Can be a flat number, Dice Notation, or a mathematical expression. Decimal numbers will be rounded down to the nearest integer.

Description: Used by the User to give Target some experience points.

Parameters.Description: Who will be healed. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
Amount of Experience Points to be given. Can be a flat number, Dice Notation, or a mathematical expression. Decimal numbers will be rounded down to the nearest integer.

Description: Used by the User to put an Altered Status on Target.

Parameters.Description: Class Id of the Altered Status to apply.
Who will be healed. Generally Target, but can be any Character.

Indicates the odds for Target to receive the Altered Status, if applicable. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
Sets the Altered Status's Power. Can be a flat number, Dice Notation, or a mathematical expression. Decimal numbers will be rounded down to the nearest integer.
Indicates how long the Altered Status will apply. Negative values indicate indefinite duration.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

If false, the player will not be informed if the Altered Status was already present and is now refreshed.

Does nothing if the Altered Status's Can Overwrite is set to false.

Description: Used by the User to increase or decrease one of Target's stats.

Parameters.Description: Identifier for the Stat Alteration. Used to check whether two different Alterations represent the same thing.
Who will be healed. Generally Target, but can be any Character.

Indicates the Stat that will be Altered.

Remember that the displayed options are internal names - display names depend on the Locale.

Indicates the odds for Target to receive the Stat Alteration, if applicable. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.
How much the Stat will be modified. Can be a flat number, Dice Notation, or a mathematical expression. Decimal numbers will be rounded down to the nearest integer.
Indicates how long the Stat Alteration will apply. Negative values indicate indefinite duration.
If enabled, multiple Stat Alterations with the same Id can be present on the same Character at the same time.

If enabled, reapplying this Stat Alteration when another with the same Id on the same Character will reset its duration.

Does nothing if Can Stack is set to enabled.
If enabled, the stat alteration will be informed in the Message Log. Disabling it can be useful for items that alter your stats when equipped.

Description: Used by the User to remove a certain Altered Status on Target. Stat Alterations with the same Id as an Altered Status will be removed as well.

Parameters.Description: Class Id of the Altered Status to remove.
Who will get an Altered Status removed. Generally Target, but can be any Character.

Indicates the odds for Target to get the Altered Status removed, if applicable. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

ComboBoxDisplayName: Remove all Alterations from one of Target's Stats
Description:
Used by the User to remove all the removable Alterations on one of Target's Stats.

Stat alterations from equipment are ignored.

Parameters.Description:
Indicates the Stat whose Alterations will be removed.

Remember that the displayed options are internal names - display names depend on the Locale.
Who will get a Stat Alteration removed. Generally Target, but can be any Character.

Indicates the odds for Target to get all Stat Alterations removed, if applicable. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.
If true, the User's positive stat modifications will be removed.
If true, the User's negative stat modifications will be removed.
If true, the User's stat modifications impacted by Altered Statuses will be removed. Altered Statuses with the same Id as a Stat Alteration will be removed as well.

ComboBoxDisplayName: Remove all Altered Statuses from Target
Description: Used by the User to remove all removable Altered Statuses on Target. Stat Alterations with the same Id as an Altered Status will be removed as well.

Parameters.Description: Who will have all Altered Statuses removed. Generally Target, but can be any Character.

Indicates the odds for Target to get the Altered Status removed, if applicable. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

TreeViewDisplayText: Remove all Alterations from all of ({Target})'s Stats
ComboBoxDisplayName: Remove all Alterations from all of Target's Stats
Description:
Used by the User to remove all the removable Alterations on all of Target's Stats.

Alterations caused by equipment will be ignored.

Parameters.Description: Who will get all Stat Alterations removed. Generally Target, but can be any Character.

Indicates the odds for Target to get all Stat Alterations removed, if applicable. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.
If true, the User's positive stat modifications will be removed.
If true, the User's negative stat modifications will be removed.
If true, the User's stat modifications impacted by Altered Statuses will be removed. Altered Statuses with the same Id as a Stat Alteration will be removed as well.

ComboBoxDisplayName: Make Target skip the next turn
Description: Used by the User to make Target skip their next turn.

Parameters.Description: Who will have the next turn skipped. Generally Target, but can be any Character.

Indicates the odds for Target to have their next turn skipped. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

Description: Used by the User to make Target end their turn.

Parameters.Description: Who will have their turn ended. Generally Target, but can be any Character.

Indicates the odds for Target to have their turn ended. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

Description: Stairs will appear in the current Floor, if there weren't any before.

User will teleport the Target to a random unoccupied Floor tile.
Fails if Target is in a Hallway tile.

Parameters.Description: Who will be Teleported. Generally Target, but can be any Character.

Indicates the odds for Target to be teleported. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

Description: User will make the Target invisible (if they were visible) or visible (if they were invisible).

Parameters.Description: Who will get their Visibility changed. Generally Target, but can be any Character.

Indicates the odds for Target to get their Visibility changed. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

Description:
User will give an item Target (if possible).
Item may come from Source's inventory, or come out of thin air

Parameters.Description: Who will give the Item. Generally Source, but can be any Character.
Who will receive the Item. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
Class Id of the Item to give.
Class Id of the Item to give. Customized.

If true, this fails if Source does not have the Item in the Inventory. If it succeeds, they give away said item.

If false, the Item materializes out of nowhere.

Indicates the odds for Target to get an Item given. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.
If false, whoever gave the Item won't be mentioned.
If true, the Player will be informed of this Item being obtained. Only applies if the Item is obtained by another Character.

Description:
User will convert the Tile.
Fails if the Tile is occupied, adjacent to an empty tile, or if it prevents map completeness.

Parameters.Description: The type this Tile will be converted to.

Indicates the odds for the Tile to be transformed. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * User's Accuracy%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.

Indicates the amount of turns in which the Tile will remain transformed before returning to its base type.

If set to a negative number, it will last until transformed again.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

Description:
User will place a Trap on the Tile.
Fails if the Tile already has one, or if it's not a Floor or Hallway Tile.

Parameters.Description: Class Id of the Trap to place.

Indicates the odds to get a Trap placed. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

Description:
User will spawn an NPC of the specified Class on the Tile.
The NPC will be of the same Faction as the User.
Fails if the Tile is occupied or isn't walkable.

Parameters.Description: Class Id of the NPC to Spawn.
Indicates the Level of the spawned NPC.

Indicates the odds for an NPC to be Spawned. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.
If true, the spawned NPC will have the same foreground and background colour as whoever spawned it.

TreeViewDisplayText: Revive an allied NPC on the Tile
Description:
User will revive an NPC of their Faction on the Tile.
The NPC will have full HP and MP.
If there are multiple valid NPCs, it will revive one at random.

Parameters.Description:
Indicates the odds for the Target tile to get an NPC revived. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

Description:
Evaluates a boolean expression.

If the expression returns true, it's a Success.
If the expression returns false, it's Failure.

Parameters.Description: The boolean expression to be evaluated.

Description:
The Dungeon will create a new Flag with the set name, or update its value if it already exists.

Depending on parameters, Flags can persist through Floors.

Remember to Set a flag before using it.

SetFlag will throw an error if it's attempted to use on a flag that is currently used as a For counter

Parameters.Description: The Flag's name.
The value to set on the Flag. Can be a value, a formula, or a string.

Parameters.DisplayName: Remove when in a new Floor?
Parameters.Description:
If checked, the Flag will be removed upon using the stairs.
If false, the Flag will persist until the end of the game.

If the Flag already existed, this has no effect.

Description: The Dungeon will call the Script of choice.

Parameters.Description: The Id of the Script to be run.

Description: Target will include the Script of choice to their list of On Attack actions. Fails if the target already knows the Script.

Parameters.Description: Who will learn the Script. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
The Id of the Script to be learned.

Indicates the odds for the Target to learn the Script. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.
If true, the Player will be informed of this Script being learnt.

Description: Target will remove the Script of choice to their list of On Attack actions. Fails if the target doesn't already know the Script.

Parameters.Description: Who will forget the Script. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
The Id of the Script to be forgotten.

Indicates the odds for the Target to forget the Script. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.
If true, the Player will be informed of this Script being learnt.

Description:
Evaluates a boolean expression.

If the expression returns true, it enters the loop.
If the expression returns false, it skips the loop.

The condition is reevaluated once the loop reaches a dead-end.

Parameters.Description: The boolean expression to be evaluated.

Description:
Sets [CounterFlagKey] to Start.

If [CounterFlagKey] <= End, it enters the loop, and increases [CounterFlagKey] by Increment.

The loop ends if [CounterFlagKey] > End

Parameters.Description: Key for the Flag that will be used as a counter.

The value where the counter starts.

Please note that For loops are of the [1;N] type rather than the [0;N) C-Style For loops.

The value where the For loop ends if it's lower than the Counter.

Please note that For loops are of the [1;N] type rather than the [0;N) C-Style For loops.
At the end of each execution of the For loop, the Counter will be increased by this value.

Description:
Creates a Yes/No prompt window to the user.

Returns true if the user selects Yes (left button), false if No (right button).

Parameters.Description: The prompt window title. Can be a Locale.
The prompt text. Can be a Locale.
The text for the "Yes" button's text. Can be a Locale.
The text for the "No" button's text. Can be a Locale.
The color of the prompt's border.

Description:
Creates a prompt window to the user where they have to choose an option.

Returns true if the user selects an option, false if the user selects Cancel.

The result will be set in a flag.

Parameters.Description: The prompt window title. Can be a Locale.
The prompt text. Can be a Locale.
If true, the prompt has a Cancel button. If false, the player is forced to select an option.
The options the player can choose.
The Key of the Flag upon which the selected option will be stored in. If the flag does not exist, it will be created.
The color of the prompt's border.

Description:
The amount of experience given by the calling object will be modified.

Throws an error if called by anything other than a Character.

Parameters.Description: The new Experience Payout formula used by this character.

TreeViewDisplayText: Switch Target character to one in ({SearchArea}) where ({SelectionCondition})
Description:
The current execution will try to replace a Target character with another.

It leaves an internal inaccessible flag to indicate which Characters have already been picked.

If it fails, the previous Target remains picked.

Parameters.Description: This condition must return true for a candidate character to be picked as a Target.
Only the Characters within the specified area (centered around the original target) can be chosen.
If true, This can be chosen as a result of this evaluation.
If true, characters allied with This can be chosen as a result of this evaluation.
If true, characters neutral with This can be chosen as a result of this evaluation.
If true, characters enemies with This can be chosen as a result of this evaluation.
If true, characters This cannot see right now can be chosen as a result of this evaluation.

If true, characters that were already picked can be chosen again in this evaluation.

Naturally, this does nothing if this function isn't called again during the current Action execution.

TreeViewDisplayText: Switch Target tile to one in ({SearchArea}) where ({SelectionCondition})
Description:
The current execution will try to replace a Target tile with another.

Ignores Stairs and Empty Tiles.

It leaves an internal inaccessible flag to indicate which Tiles have already been picked.

If it fails, the previous Target remains picked.

Parameters.Description: This condition must return true for a candidate tile to be picked as a Target.
Only the Tiles within the specified area (centered around the original target) can be chosen.
If true, Wall tiles can be chosen as a result of this evaluation.
If true, Hallway tiles can be chosen as a result of this evaluation.
If true, tiles This cannot see right now can be chosen as a result of this evaluation.

If true, tiles that were already picked can be chosen again in this evaluation.

Naturally, this does nothing if this function isn't called again during the current Action execution.

Description: The Action's Target will be restored to the original.

TreeViewDisplayText: Ask to select an Item due to ({Title}) and store the choice into [({OptionFlag})]
Description:
Creates a prompt window to the user where they have to choose an Item from a list.

Returns true if the user selects an Item, false if the user selects Cancel.

The Class Id of the chosen Item will be set in a flag.

Parameters.Description: The prompt window title. Can be a Locale.
If true, the prompt has a Cancel button. If false, the player is forced to select an option.
The Items the player can choose.
The Key of the Flag upon which the Id of the selected Item Class will be stored in. If the flag does not exist, it will be created.

TreeViewDisplayText: Ask to select an Item from ({Target})'s Inventory due to ({Title}) and store the choice into [({OptionFlag})]
Description:
Creates a prompt window to the user where they have to choose an Item from the Target's Inventory.

Returns true if the user selects an Item, false if the user selects Cancel.

The Class Id of the chosen Item will be set in a flag.

Parameters.Description: Who will offer their Items. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
The prompt window title. Can be a Locale.
If true, the prompt has a Cancel button. If false, the player is forced to select an option.
The Key of the Flag upon which the Id of the selected Item Class will be stored in. If the flag does not exist, it will be created.

TreeViewDisplayText: Ask to select an Action from ({Target})'s Interactions due to ({Title}) and store the choice into [({OptionFlag})] and the school into [({SchoolFlag})]
Description:
Creates a prompt window to the user where they have to choose one of Target's Interactions.

Interactions from Consumables are not included.

Returns true if the user selects an Item, false if the user selects Cancel.

The Id of the chosen Action will be set in a flag, as will the Action School.

Parameters.Description: Whose Interactions will be shown. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
The prompt window title. Can be a Locale.
If true, the prompt has a Cancel button. If false, the player is forced to select an option.
The Key of the Flag upon which the Id of the selected Action will be stored in. If the flag does not exist, it will be created.
The Key of the Flag upon which the School of the selected Action will be stored in. If the flag does not exist, it will be created.

Description:
Modifies the Cooldown of one of Target's Interaction Actions by the specified value.

Can modify all Actions, all from a specific School, or one Action in particular.

Interactions from Consumables can't be altered.

Returns true if at least an Action got its Cooldown modified.

Can affect Actions without a base Cooldown higher than 0.

Parameters.Description: Whose Actions will get their Cooldown Modified. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
The School whose Actions will get their Cooldown Modified.
The specific Selection Id of the Action that will get its Cooldown Modified.
Indicates how turns will the Cooldown of the Actions get altered by. Can be any number, but Cooldown will not get dropped any lower than 0.

Indicates the odds for Actions to get their Cooldown Modified. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.
If true, the Player will be informed of the Action Cooldown Change (if applicable).

Description:
Modifies the Uses of one of Target's Interaction Actions by the specified value.

Can modify all Actions, all from a specific School, or one Action in particular.

Interactions from Consumables can't be altered.

Returns true if at least an Action got its Uses modified.

Cannot give an amount of Uses higher than the Maximum Uses.

Parameters.Description: Whose Actions will get their Uses Modified. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
The School whose Actions will get their Uses Modified.
The specific Selection Id of the Action that will get its Uses Modified.
Indicates how Uses the Actions will get (if positive) or lose (if negative). Can be any number, but the Uses of an Action cannot drop lower than 0 nor be higher than the Maximum Uses.

Indicates the odds for Actions to get their Uses Modified. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.
If true, the Player will be informed of the Action Uses Change (if applicable).

Description: Used by the User to increase or decrease Target's Sight Range.

Parameters.Description: Who will be get their Sight Range modified. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
Indicates the new value for the Target's Sight Range.
The specific Amount of Tiles the Sight Range will be modified to.
Indicates how long the Sight Range Alteration will apply. Negative values indicate indefinite duration.

Indicates the odds for Target to receive the Stat Alteration, if applicable. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.
If enabled, the Sight Range alteration will be informed in the Message Log. Disabling it can be useful for passive changes.

Description:
Used by the User to reveal either the Floor Plan or the Traps to Target.

Specifically if the Target is the Player, it returns a Failure if there's nothing left to reveal.

Parameters.Description: Who will get a revelation. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
Indicates what will be revealed to the Target.

Indicates the odds for Target to receive the Stat Alteration, if applicable. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.
If true, the Player will be informed of this Revelation.

TreeViewDisplayText: Generate ({Amount}) Items on Own's Inventory using Loot Table ({Id}) as a reference
ComboBoxDisplayName: Fill Own's Inventory from a Loot Table
Description:
Used by the User to generate Items on their Inventory, using the odds from a Loot Table as reference.

Entries involving Currency Drops are treated as No Drop.

Parameters.Description: Indicates the Id of the Loot Table to be used.
Indicates the maximum amount of Items to be Generated. If higher than the Character's amount of free inventory slots, it will be capped to said amount.

TreeViewDisplayText: Open Prompt to Sell Items from the Inventory to ({Target})
Description:
Used by the User to offer Items to sell.

If used on a Player, a Prompt will be opened.

Returns Success if a sale was made, Failure otherwise or if the seller has no items.

Parameters.Description: Who will buy the Items. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
The prompt window title. Can be a Locale.
If true, the prompt has a Cancel button. If false, the player is forced to select an option.

TreeViewDisplayText: Open Prompt to Buy Items from ({Target})'s Inventory
Description:
Used by the User to buy items from someone else.

If used by a Player, a Prompt will be opened.

Returns Success if a purchase was made, Failure otherwise or if the buyer's inventory is full (in which case there will be no prompt).

Parameters.Description: Who will sell the Items. Generally Target, but can be any Character.
The prompt window title. Can be a Locale.
If true, the prompt has a Cancel button. If false, the player is forced to select an option.

Description:
Used by the User to Identify an Item.

Returns true if the Item was Identified.

Returns false if the User does not own that Item, or if the Item is already Identified

Parameters.Description: The Id of the Item to be Identified.

Indicates the odds for Actions to get their Cooldown Modified. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

Description:
Used by the User to Identify all of Target's Items, including both Inventory and Equipment.

Returns true if at least one Item was Identified.

Returns false if the User does have any Items, or if they are all already Identified

Parameters.Description: Who will sell the Items. Generally Target, but can be any Character.

Indicates the odds for Actions to get their Cooldown Modified. Final Accuracy is calculated with Accuracy * (User's Accuracy - Target's Evasion)%.

User's Accuracy is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character. Target's Evasion is calculated as 0 if it's not a Character.
If true, the User's Accuracy (if it's a Character) and Target's Evasion will be ignored.

Description:
Used to force this NPC to target a Waypoint with the Specified Id.

If there are multiple Waypoints with the same Id, they will pursue one at random.

The NPC will not target anyone in the process.

The NPC will keep pursuing the Waypoint until it's reached or told to stop.

Does nothing if executed on a Player Character.

Parameters.Description: The Id of the Waypoint to pursue.

ComboBoxDisplayName: Make NPC stop following a Waypoint
Description:
Used to force this NPC to no longer target whatever Waypoint they are targeting.

Does nothing if executed on a Player Character.
